metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23094 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Libreswan 4.2 through 4.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via a crafted IKEv1 packet because pluto/ikev1.c wrongly expects that a state object exists. This is fixed in 4.6.

criterions.comment: libreswan: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
